title: UPDATE: Police search for suspect involved in Norfolk shooting
content:
NORFOLK--Three men are now in custody and police are searching for an additional suspect following a shooting that involved multiple victims outside the Lexington Park Apartments on June 22. Six people, including a suspect, were injured.
Montrel Antonio Beasley, 24, has been charged with possession of a firearm by a convicted felon and is currently in the Norfolk City Jail.
Darren Lamont Roberts and Kyle Edward Thornton were arrested last week in connection to the shooting.
Police continue to search for 25-year-old Curtis Leon Williams. He has warrants for six counts of malicious wounding, six counts of use or display of a firearm in commission of felony, and discharging a firearm in a home.
According to Norfolk Police Spokesperson Chris Amos, Thornton and another suspect were involved in an altercation that ended with gunfire and Thornton being injured.
During this time, Darren Roberts pulled a handgun and began shooting.
The shooting victims include a 16-year-old, 17-year-old and three other adults.
Amos said none of the injuries appear to be life threatening.
Anyone with information is encouraged to call the Crime Line at 1-888-LOCK-U-UP.
